review_blob: Easy drinking porter.  Chocolate, roasted malt, caramel .  Medium bodied, and lighter on the palette than youd expect.  Nice to have a "winter" beer that goes down easy.  Another winner from Ale Asylum.

Unreal.  Just cracked a bottle from my winter stash, and still great.  Heavy Grapefruit Mango aroma to go with orange opaque pour / thin tan head.  Crisp citrus taste and solid hoppy backbone.  Belgian yeast gives it a mellow sweetness that sends it over the top.  Top notch.

Very citrus aroma, more muted and balanced on the palette.  Cloudy almost amber pour with thin soapy head and moderate lacing.  Great standard IPA, nothing extreme or gimmicky.  Ale Asylum gets it right again...
